thread.title: Areas of UK most opposed to Donald Trump's state visit revealed as 1.3m sign petition
thread.title_full: Areas of UK most opposed to Donald Trump's state visit revealed as 1.3m sign petition

author: mirror
title: Areas of UK most opposed to Donald Trump's state visit revealed as 1.3m sign petition

locations.name: oval office of the white house

text:
News Areas of UK most opposed to Donald Trump's state visit revealed as 1.3m sign petition One of the top areas for people to sign the petition was from Labour Leader Jeremy Corbyn's constituency Share US President Donald Trump gives a thumbs up as he speaks on the phone to King Salman of Saudi Arabia in the Oval Office of the White House yesterday (Photo: AFP) Share Get politics updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
People in parts of Brighton, Islington and Bristol are the most likely to have signed the 1.3million strong petition calling for Donald Trump ’s state visit to be cancelled. 
Some 6,105 people in Brighton Pavilion have signed the petition at last count, which passed one million signatures this morning. 
That works out at one person in 18 in Caroline Lucas’s constituency, the highest share in the country. 
And one person in 19 in Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn 's constituency of Islington North have signed it, along with one in 20 in west Bristol. Map of signatories as % of population. The darker shade of red = higher share of people signing it. (Photo: https://docs.google.com/a/trinitymirror.com/open?id=1p7l6q1F7Ws2QTPFDqME8gFGR4hz-9MT4z8M96uLXigc) Read More Theresa May didn’t condemn Donald Trump’s refugee ban because she’d been 'in meetings all day' 
Other areas where more than 5,000 people each have put their names to the petition include Hornsey and Wood Green, Hackney North and Stoke Newington and Hackney South and Shoreditch. 
The petition argues that any state visit to the UK by the new American president would “cause embarrassment to Her Majesty the Queen”. 
The total signatures on the petition here stood at 1,351,000 at 4.30pm today and had recorded 31,794 signatures in the past hour. 
The petition comes after Mr Trump signed an executive order on Friday which suspended people from seven countries from entering the United States - Iraq, Syria, Iran, Sudan, Libya, Somalia and Yemen - for 90 days. Demonstrators protest against President Trump's executive immigration ban at Chicago O'Hare International Airport at the weekend (Photo: AFP) Prime Minister Theresa May, arriving at Cardiff City Hal today, has been under fire for her handling of the issue (Photo: Getty) Read More What is the State Visits Committee and did it invite Donald Trump to Britain? Your questions answered 
It also suspended the US Refugee Admissions Program for 120 days. 
The order caused disruption at American airports over the weekend as affected people found out they were no longer allowed to enter the United States. 
The petition is not limited to British citizens - some 5,382 people from the US had signed it at last count, as well as 57 people from the seven countries mentioned in the order. DATA, TOP 10 AREAS WITH HIGHEST PROPORTIONS OF SIGNATURES 
Rank / Constituency / Signatures / One in X people signing petition 
1 / Brighton, Pavilion / 6,105 / 18 
2 / Islington North / 5,885 / 19 
3 / Bristol West / 6,822 / 20 
3 / Hornsey and Wood Green / 6,489 / 20 
5 / Hackney North and Stoke Newington / 6,534 / 21 
6 / Hackney South and Shoreditch / 5,895 / 22 
6 / Dulwich and West Norwood / 5,206 / 22 
8 / Edinburgh North and Leith / 4,820 / 23 
8 / Lewisham, Deptford / 5,314 / 23 
8 / Bethnal Green and Bow / 6,043 / 23 
11 / Manchester, Withington / 4,089 / 25 
11 / Hove / 4,107 / 25 
11 / Islington South and Finsbury / 4,584 / 25 
11 / Holborn and St Pancras / 5,860 / 25 
11 / Vauxhall / 4,814 / 25
